bwwExcerpt: Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss' score is immediately hummable in the way that only derivative disco music can be. The often witty book, built around a competition among the six wives of Henry VIII, borrows a lot from "RuPaul's Drag Race" while offering yet another #MeToo story. Those theatrical commonplaces aside, "Six" is a needed antidote to "Anastasia," "Frozen," "Jagged Little Pill," "Wicked" and other pompous shows of female empowerment.
